# Checking for ApplePay availability

!image-20220803-234039.png|width=41.666666666666664%!

fields.description:
*Background:*

    Currently, when we make a payment with a new client that have just onboarded to FatZebra in the {{local/test/uat}} environment, the payment would always be failed due to the response code is 99. 

    This is because that the "Switch" is not “Test“. 

    The current solution is just that we need to email to FZ to make the new client’s “Switch“ set up to “Test”. 

    And [~accountid:60d3003af65054006958575f] had emailed to FZ to ask if there are any ways to auto-set up the “Switch“ to “Test“, they replied us they are working on a fix for it.

    So in this card, just often email to FZ to track this issue.



*The Affected Environments:*

    local

    test

    uat

fields.description:
Phoenix reconciliation report is similar to MyAccount. 

* _Need to know what fields to put into the report   (_[~accountid:557058:241bc4d4-5910-4786-afe7-37254c0cada5] _)_
** No additional fields required. We can use the same attached template.
** File name: fz-Phoenix-reconciliation-report-CURRENCYTYPE-YYYY-MM-DDTHH_MM_SS.SSSSSSS
** CurrencyType to be depicted as AUD or NZD
* do we also need to have currency requirements to handle NZD? ([~accountid:557058:241bc4d4-5910-4786-afe7-37254c0cada5] )
** Yes

[^fz-myaccount-reconciliation-report-2022-08-15T22_01_00.661898522.csv]



Generate report and upload to SFTP

# Create a new folder “ Phoenix” in SFTP/ S3 at the same level as MyAccount
# Create a subfolder in Phoenix as “ transaction-report
# Create two subfolders AUD and NZD in “ transaction-report” folder
# Upload daily files generated for AUD transactions under the subfolder AUD
# Upload daily files generated for NZD transactions under the subfolder NZD

Generation logic: Report to be generated daily at 08.00 AEST including public holidays for previous day transactions. 

*Out of scope:* Send an email to the finance team

fields.description:
*Background:*  As part of current implementation, our development team uses Merchant Test UI to test their development work. To support card tokenization process via FZ, we need to enhance Merchant Test UI.

*Scope:*

# Add {{Save FatZebra Card}} function in Merchant test UI
# On click of the button, ask user to provide details similar to Bambora card
## FS client ID
## Secret ID and Key
# Once card details are entered and saved, verify card token is successfully generated.
# Add some UI tests to cover the card tokenization process

*Out of scope*

No UI for payment processing via Fat Zebra

*Notes:*

Include card tokenization for Phoenix flow into  [https://test-fs-plat-pymt-sel-merchant-test.svc.platform.XXXXdev.com/card.html|https://test-fs-plat-pymt-sel-merchant-test.svc.platform.XXXXdev.com/card.html] 

Include UI test cases



!image-20220725-023509.png|width=3056,height=962!

* We need to add one new button, {{Save FatZebra Card}} 
* We can refer to the {{Save Bambora Card}} feature.
* UI test cases
** Add a credit card to FatZebra successfully.
** error cases
*** tokenized card failed
*** duplicate request (click the same link again after successful completion) - Consider if this scenario is easy to simulate.



[https://XXXXconfluence.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/FSP/pages/8863482127/Credit+Card+Tokenization|https://XXXXconfluence.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/FSP/pages/8863482127/Credit+Card+Tokenization|smart-link]

comments.body: payment id : {{08db119a-830c-4917-95c1-94be4a95ffaf}}

*Error message*

{{Encounter exception during complete payment phase, General payment complete error. message: current payment transaction d9a83d9e-4e05-407e-8b86-83d965371a88 status PROCESSING can not transfer to PROCESSING_payment: Payment(id=08db119a-830c-4917-95c1-94be4a95ffaf, fsClientId=10034127}}}

*Analysis*



Credit card call back endpoint was called at {{05/09/2022 11:14:07.523 AM +0800}}, and the payment status was changed from {{INITIALISED}} to {{PROCESSING}}

!image-20220906-062323.png|width=1141,height=235!

It was called again with the same payment id at {{05/09/2022 11:14:11.583 AM +0800}}, but payment status can not be from {{PROCESSING}} to {{PROCESSING}}. Therefore exception was thrown, and Prometheus alert was triggered.

!image-20220906-062259.png|width=1144,height=339!

Finally the first complete call back request was processed successfully.

!image-20220906-071339.png|width=1124,height=357!

Yeah, I don’t see any issue with this transaction. the status is archived for payment and completed for transaction. the file has been uploaded to PR_OIP_CC as flag is set to true
we can close this card
[~accountid:5f9895fb62584c006bd2f674]
